movie_title: Divorce: Why does it happen? ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: How is divorced talked about in different countries? Georgie and Phil teach you some new vocabulary.

vocabulary.definition: the legal dissolution of a marriage by a court or other competent body
vocabulary.example: After years of unhappiness, they finally decided to get a divorce.

vocabulary.definition: not able to be resolved, fixed, or satisfactorily ended
vocabulary.example: Their differences were so deep that the issue became unresolvable.

vocabulary.definition: to become involved in a situation in order to improve it or prevent it from getting worse
vocabulary.example: The teacher had to intervene to stop the students from arguing.
He is invariably late to every meeting.

vocabulary.definition: a period of time in which two parties can try to improve a situation before taking further action
vocabulary.example: They agreed to a cooling-off period before making any final decisions about the business deal.

vocabulary.definition: a mother who stays at home to take care of the children and manage the household
vocabulary.example: She decided to be a stay-at-home mum after her second child was born.
